required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: InFlux System for Nasal Breathing Improvement
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of Aerin Medical's InFlux System for Improvement in Nasal Breathing

brief_summary.textblock: Pilot Study of the Aerin Medical Wand used for Improvement in Nasal Breathing

detailed_description.textblock: This is a non-significant risk, prospective, non-randomized pilot study to evaluate the incidence of serious adverse events directly attributable to the Aerin Medical Wand, when used to deliver radiofrequency (RF) energy to tissues of the nasal airway for the treatment of nasal obstruction.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Unanticipated Serious Adverse Device Effects
primary_outcome.description: The study will be considered to have met its primary safety endpoint if no subject experiences an unanticipated serious adverse device effect (USADE defined as any serious adverse effect caused by, or associated with, the investigational device, that was not previously identified in nature, severity, or degree of incidence in the protocol)

primary_outcome.measure: Technical Feasibility as Assessed by the Ability of the InFlux Device to Deliver RF Energy to Target Tissue
primary_outcome.description: Ability of the InFlux device to deliver RF energy at the selected power setting, and to reach and maintain the selected target temperature.

arm_group.description: Intervention: Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway

intervention.intervention_name: Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway
intervention.description: The Vivaer Stylus is used to deliver low-power, temperature-controlled, radiofrequency energy to tissues of the nasal airway to cause coagulation of soft tissues and submucosal tissue shrinkage.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with history of Chronic nasal obstruction and Poor nasal breathing
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with prior nasal history, nasal pathology, or injury, and/or other conditions that may interfere with participation in the study

group.title: InFlux System
group.description: Intervention: Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway: The Vivaer Stylus is used to deliver low-power, temperature-controlled, radiofrequency energy to tissues of the nasal airway to cause coagulation of soft tissues and submucosal tissue shrinkage.

group.title: InFlux System
group.description: Intervention: Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway: The Vivaer Stylus is used to deliver low-power, temperature-controlled, radiofrequency energy to tissues of the nasal airway to cause coagulation of soft tissues and submucosal tissue shrinkage.

measure.title: Nasal Obstruction Symptom Evaluation (NOSE) score
measure.description: The Nasal Obstruction Symptom Evaluation (NOSE) scale is a validated disease-specific health status outcomes instrument, used to assess severity of nasal obstruction symptoms. Score ranges from 0 to 100. Higher scores indicate increased symptoms/symptom severity.

outcome.title: Incidence of Unanticipated Serious Adverse Device Effects
outcome.description: The study will be considered to have met its primary safety endpoint if no subject experiences an unanticipated serious adverse device effect (USADE defined as any serious adverse effect caused by, or associated with, the investigational device, that was not previously identified in nature, severity, or degree of incidence in the protocol)
outcome.population: One subject was lost-to-follow-up prior to the 90-day follow-up visit. Therefore, 32 subjects were available for analysis at the 90-day time point.

group.title: InFlux System
group.description: Intervention: Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway: The Vivaer Stylus is used to deliver low-power, temperature-controlled, radiofrequency energy to tissues of the nasal airway to cause coagulation of soft tissues and submucosal tissue shrinkage.

measure.title: Incidence of Unanticipated Serious Adverse Device Effects
measure.description: The study will be considered to have met its primary safety endpoint if no subject experiences an unanticipated serious adverse device effect (USADE defined as any serious adverse effect caused by, or associated with, the investigational device, that was not previously identified in nature, severity, or degree of incidence in the protocol)
measure.population: One subject was lost-to-follow-up prior to the 90-day follow-up visit. Therefore, 32 subjects were available for analysis at the 90-day time point.

outcome.title: Technical Feasibility as Assessed by the Ability of the InFlux Device to Deliver RF Energy to Target Tissue
outcome.description: Ability of the InFlux device to deliver RF energy at the selected power setting, and to reach and maintain the selected target temperature.
outcome.population: All enrolled subjects underwent the procedure.

group.title: InFlux System
group.description: Intervention: Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway: The Vivaer Stylus is used to deliver low-power, temperature-controlled, radiofrequency energy to tissues of the nasal airway to cause coagulation of soft tissues and submucosal tissue shrinkage.

measure.title: Technical Feasibility as Assessed by the Ability of the InFlux Device to Deliver RF Energy to Target Tissue
measure.description: Ability of the InFlux device to deliver RF energy at the selected power setting, and to reach and maintain the selected target temperature.
measure.population: All enrolled subjects underwent the procedure.

outcome.title: NOSE Score at 90-day Follow-up
outcome.description: The Nasal Obstruction Symptom Evaluation (NOSE) scale is a validated disease-specific health status outcomes instrument, used to assess severity of nasal obstruction symptoms. Score ranges from 0 to 100. Higher scores indicate increased symptoms/symptom severity. Each subject's NOSE score at the 90-day follow-up was compared to that subject's baseline NOSE score to determine change in nasal obstruction symptoms.

group.title: InFlux System
group.description: Intervention: Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway: The Vivaer Stylus is used to deliver low-power, temperature-controlled, radiofrequency energy to tissues of the nasal airway to cause coagulation of soft tissues and submucosal tissue shrinkage.

measure.title: NOSE Score at 90-day Follow-up
measure.description: The Nasal Obstruction Symptom Evaluation (NOSE) scale is a validated disease-specific health status outcomes instrument, used to assess severity of nasal obstruction symptoms. Score ranges from 0 to 100. Higher scores indicate increased symptoms/symptom severity. Each subject's NOSE score at the 90-day follow-up was compared to that subject's baseline NOSE score to determine change in nasal obstruction symptoms.

group.title: InFlux System
group.description: Intervention: Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway Procedure: thermal coagulation of tissue in the nasal airway: The Vivaer Stylus is used to deliver low-power, temperature-controlled, radiofrequency energy to tissues of the nasal airway to cause coagulation of soft tissues and submucosal tissue shrinkage.

event.sub_title: Upper respiratory infection / symptoms of common cold
event.description: Adverse events deemed not related to the investigational device or procedure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Scott Wolf, M.D., President and Chief Medical Officer
